abstractText: Tallying the number and size of large wood pieces that are present within the bankfull channel, including qualifying side-channels.The bankfull channel is defined as the channel that is filled by moderate sized flood events that typically recur every one to two years. LWD in or above the bankfull channel is tallied over the entire length of the reach, including the area between the channel cross-section transects.LWD qualifications and classifications are similar to those found in the BLM AIM protocol.
title: Tallying Large Woody Debris v1.0
